register.helpText:
The registration data of the DEAU depends on whether it is a state body or a private legal entity.: 

For a state body 

  1. Data about the applicant: 

  • Type of identifier – automatically filled in after logging in with UEI; 

  • Unit number/Personal identification number of the applicant – automatically filled in after logging in with UEI; 

  • Name of the applicant – automatically filled in after login with UEI; 

  • Data for a state authority: 

  • Name of administrative authority – drop-down field – mandatory – contains a list of all DEAUs registered in IISDA; 

  • UIK/BULSTAT – text field that accepts only numbers and has validation for UIK/BULSTAT format – mandatory – automatically filled in based on selection of DEAU; 

  • Headquarters – text field – mandatory – automatically filled in based on selection of DEAU; 

  • Address of management – text field – mandatory – automatically filled based on DEAU selection; 

  • Official email address for contact with the supplier – text field with email format validation – mandatory

  • Phone number for contact with the supplier – text field that accepts only numbers and the sign „+“ – mandatory – contact phone number 

    2. DEAU administrator data: 

  • Identifier type – drop-down menu with options „ЕГН“ and „ЛНЧ“ – mandatory; 

  • ЕГН/ЛНЧ – text field that accepts only numbers and has validation for the format of the UGN/LNH – mandatory; 

  • Names – text field – mandatory; 

  • Email for contact with the administrator  - text field with validation for the format of the email – mandatory; 

  • Phone for contact with the administrator - text field that accepts only numbers and the sign „+“ – mandatory; 

  • Files –. Each of the attached documents must be in PDF format and signed with a qualified electronic signature of the applicant submitting registration to DEAU. For each attached file, the date and time of attachment will be added systematically. Registrations with attached documents that are not signed with a qualified electronic signature (QES) will not be able to be submitted; 

  • Date – date field – is automatically filled with the current date. 

  For private legal entity 

  • Applicant data: 

  • Identifier type – is automatically filled after logging in with UEI; 

  • Applicant's personal identification number/personal identification number – is automatically filled after logging in with UEI; 

  • Applicant's name – automatically filled in after login with UEI; 

  • Data for a private legal entity: 

  • Name of administrative authority – text field – mandatory; 

  • UIC/BULSTAT – text field that accepts only numbers and has validation for UIC/BULSTAT format – mandatory; 

  • Headquarters – text field – mandatory; 

  • Address of management – text field – mandatory; 

  • Official email address for contacting the supplier – text field with validation for email format – mandatory; 

  • Contact phone number for contacting the supplier– text field that accepts only numbers and the sign „+“ – mandatory; 

  • Data for DEAU administrator: 

  • Identifier type – drop-down menu with options „ЕГН“ and „ЛНЧ“ – mandatory; 

  • ЕГН/ЛНЧ – text field that accepts only numbers and has validation for EGN/LНЧ format – mandatory; 

  • Names – text field – required; 

  • Administrator contact email - text field with email format validation – required; 

  • Administrator contact phone - text field that accepts only numbers and the „+“ sign – mandatory; 

  • Files – optional field – files can be attached if necessary. Each of the attached documents must be in PDF format and signed with a qualified electronic signature of the applicant submitting a registration to DEAU. For each attached file, the date and time of attachment will be added automatically. Registrations with attached documents that are not signed with a qualified electronic signature (QES) will not be able to be submitted; 

  • Date – date field – is automatically filled in with the current date.

errors.invalidAssuranceLevel: Please select a level of Assurance

service-add.helpText:
• Name– enter a short and clear name of the electronic administrative service. The name should be understandable to citizens and businesses and describe the main action or purpose of the service.

  • Description– provide a detailed description of the service. Describe what it is.

  • Can be empowered– indicate whether authorization for the service can be created for the execution by third parties.

  • Assurance level– select the level of electronic identification required to access the service:

    • Substantial - a level of electronic identification suitable for services where:

      • no particularly sensitive data is processed;

      • the actions do not have major legal or financial consequences;

      • the risk of unauthorized access is lower.

    • High - This is the highest level of electronic identification, which guarantees maximum security when accessing the service. It is used for services that:

      • require protection of sensitive personal data;

      • have legal or financial consequences for the applicant;

      • involve access to registers or actions on behalf of other persons.

    • Required personal information - describe what personal data is necessary to provide the service. List only the data that is absolutely necessary for the performance of the service.

    • Extent of representative authority– specify the scope of powers that can be granted to the authorized person.

loginPage.txtLoginWithEidEmployee: Login with eID as an employee
loginPage.txtAuthApprovalReqDescription: Please confirm the authentication request on your mobile device in order to proceed
loginPage.txtAdditionalText:
The portal for integration with a government electronic identification scheme serves to service administrative and business processes in interaction between the centralized electronic identification system and electronic identity administrators (AEI), electronic identification centers (CEI) and electronic administrative service providers (DEAU).

More information can be found on the page Useful information
